intro: Camissonia pallida, commonly known as the pale camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Camissonia pallida is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting well to dry conditions with its deep root system.
